laboratory_examinations.findings: Thyroid is homogeneous. No axillary lymphadenopathy. Numerous calcified mediastinal and hilar lymph nodes correspond to previously seen discrete high-density foci in the mediastinum. No pathologically enlarged lymph nodes. Heart is normal size; no pericardial effusion noted. Thoracic aorta and main pulmonary artery normal in caliber. Airway patent to subsegmental level. Multiple pulmonary nodules measured up to 4 mm. A moderate mildly complex left pleural effusion unchanged. No right pleural effusion. Mild bibasilar atelectasis but no consolidation.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: A moderate mildly complex left pleural effusion is unchanged over the short time interval since the previous exam.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Stage II inflammation and grade 2 to 3 fibrosis.
Viral load was negative after initial viral load was over 4 million units per mL.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Initial viral load declined to negative one month into treatment.
